intro: Mentha × rubescens, commonly known as red mint, is a hybrid species within the mint family, Lamiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and vibrant reddish-pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows as an upright perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are often a deep green with a slight reddish tinge, and it has a strong, menthol-like fragrance. Red mint is often used in culinary applications and traditional medicine due to its essential oils and therapeutic properties.
